proposed_strategy.name: Single Section Chunking
proposed_strategy.description: The provided text constitutes a single structural unit (the Sixth Prashna) which is significantly below the safety character limit, allowing it to be processed in a single chunk.

execution_plan.description: The entirety of the Sixth Prashna (Mantra 1 through 8) and its accompanying Prakashika commentary, including the concluding summary and doxology.

parsing_instructions.justification: The document structures content around individual Mantras, which are followed immediately by their respective commentary (Prakashika). The Mantra serves as the optimal atomic unit containing both source text and exegesis.

start_pattern.description: A new Mantra unit (source text followed by commentary) begins immediately after the numerical end marker (।। [num] ।।) of the previous Mantra's text, or after a structural boundary (like a Prashna heading).
examples: **अथ हैनं सुकेशा भारद्वाजः पप्रच्छ** (Start of Mantra 1)

end_pattern.description: The end of the root Mantra text is consistently marked by a Devanagari numeral enclosed in double danda, which acts as the delimiter separating the source text from the commentary.

parsing_instructions.pre_content_handling: The initial lines providing the Grantha title, Prashna number, and subject heading (e.g., **प्रश्नोपनिषत्**, **षष्ठः प्रश्नः**) should be treated as structural headers before Mantra 1 begins. The final metrical verse (`क्षेमाय य: करुणया...`) and the final colophons are concluding material.
